intro: Eriocaulon hookerianum var. microphyllum, commonly known as the small-leaved flat sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy environments, such as swamps and seasonally flooded areas. Its leaves are short and densely packed, giving it a compact appearance. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland ecosystems and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
